content: this legal case involves a dispute between two parties over the ownership of a property the case was heard in the municipal court split and has been ongoing for 8 years and 7 months the final resolution of the case was the dissolution of the coownership with the property being divided equally between the parties the property in question is a house auxiliary building and yard the division of the property was based on proposals made by the claimant and the proposed party and the decision was made in accordance with the property act the claimants are registered coowners of half the property while the respondent retains the other half the claimants proposed terminating the coownership and dividing the property or selling it and dividing the funds the claimants emphasized the need for a fair division and an onsite inspection confirmed the legal interest and estimated value of the property the claimants were willing to collaborate and compensate the respondent for a peaceful resolution but the respondent denied their ownership rights and opposed the proposed division the judge considered the relevant property laws and the complexity of the situation the claimants sought exactly half the value of the property while the respondent suggested a division that is less than half the judge took into account the duration of the procedure and the dual designations of the property in the land registry ultimately the judge accepted the claimants proposal which established condominium ownership and separate parts of the property with certain limitations and restrictions
